message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with wireless broadcast networks and packet transmissions, which are typically studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories. The problem of broadcasting in the presence of side information is a generalization of the index coding problem, which is a well-known problem in Information Theory. Therefore, cs.IT is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses a dynamic max-weight algorithm, which is a common optimization technique used in the Design and Analysis of Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper also presents a set of codes based on cycles in the demand graph, which is a graph-theoretic approach and can be classified under the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with capacity regions and coding actions, which are topics that fall under the Signal Processing (cs.SP) and Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-categories. However, these sub-categories are less likely as they are not directly mentioned in the abstract or title.
